title: docs: ✏️ handshake root bucket id creation
feat: bucket status
body:
Allow us (the controllers) to query for canister status of the root buckets

title: feat: cover compliance
body:
Bring build process up to date with cover compliance and 0.9.3
- move canister types to rust
- rename (`ic-history-* -> cap_*`) canisters and packages
- update wasm import paths
- remove build.js
- update CI

title: Batch transaction
body: Also contains refactors done on the multi bucket PR, but these are safe to land once tested.

title: chore: 🤖 add fleek testnet to dfx.json
body:
## Why?

The dfx.json should have the fleek testnet, as it'll be required for automating deployments e.g. staging https://github.com/Psychedelic/nft-marketplace-fe/pull/71 which depends on this PR

## How?

- Add feek testnet network to dfx.json

title: WIP: Multi canister bucket
body: This PR implements the multi-canister architecture for the buckets, to allow storing history when it doesn't fit in just one canister.

title: chore: 🤖 add motoko sdk as external, git submodule
add a balance method to the root bucket
body: This adds the balance method to the root bucket. The upgrade process needs to be tested.

title: Motoko sdk
body: Fixed some compile errors and warnings in Cap.mo

title: visibility, candid type fixes
body: DIP20Details needs to be public for the TXRecord -> IndefiniteEvent conversion

title: Implement post_upgrade & add contract_id to root bucket
body: Once we switch to use certified-vars, this custom serialization logic won't be needed anymore, but for now it's okay although I don't really like how it looks atm.

title: Fix function name in router and add default controller for new canister
Change plug principal id to production one
Add True/False and remove status
body: This adds the missing support for booleans in the DetailValue and removes the `Status`, if there is a use case like XTC they can have a `failed = True` in details

title: Minor Clippy Fixes
body:
Fixes a some clippy lints, there isn't anything to review really. I just wanted to get @qti3e's approval instead of just committing to main.

It's going to fail CI because one of the lints is on some code with a TODO annotation.

title: add newly installed canisters to root buckets map
Fix various clippy lints.
body:
Fixes various clippy lints throughout the repository.

My reasoning with making all the members private on events is because there's a configuration of the type which is invalid. Thus, we really shouldn't ever let it be constructed in an invalid state. I don't see a need for the type to not be immutable also, so it should be fine.

title: V2
body: We're going forward with the V2 spec, so let's merge the branch to main and go forward.
